description: The Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Institute will hold the 18th edition of its Global Forum on Islamic Finance on April 28, 2024, in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The forum coincides with the IsDB Group Annual Meetings and Golden Jubilee Celebration. This flagship event brings together prominent figures in Islamic finance, including thought leaders, policymakers, and financial […]
title: IsDB Institute to host 18th Global Forum on Islamic Finance in Riyadh

description: In a significant move to bolster medical tourism, the Minister of Health and Population, Khaled Abdel Ghaffar, presided over the signing of a strategic partnership between the Ministry and the Egyptian Commercial Service (ECS), an entity under the Ministry of Trade and Industry. title: Health Ministry collaborates with ECS to boost medical tourism, global outreach

description: Tarek El Molla, Minister of Petroleum and Mineral Resources, recently reviewed the ongoing construction of the Suez Methanol Derivatives Company’s facility. Situated within the Egyptian Petrochemicals Holding Company (ECHEM) in Damietta Port, the plant spans 100,000 sqm and is backed by a $120m investment. The company has secured full capitalization for the project, ensuring the […]
title: Minister of Petroleum reviews progress at Suez Methanol Derivatives plant in Damietta

description: The Arabian Kuwaiti Group is set to bolster its presence in the Egyptian market with a significant increase in investments, targeting the attraction of over 100,000 tourists annually to its flourishing tourism ventures. title: Arabian Kuwaiti Group prepares to unveil branded residences in West Cairo

description: In a recent meeting with the ministers of Irrigation and Foreign Affairs, Egypt’s Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly emphasized the country’s commitment to fostering cooperation with South Sudan. title: Prime Minister Madbouly reviews cooperation with South Sudan

description: The head of a statue of King Ramses II has been returned to Egypt, following successful efforts by the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities to track down and recover the smuggled artefact. The statue head was officially handed over to the Egyptian authorities in July by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The Ministry of Tourism […]
title: Ramses II statue head returns to Egypt after repatriation from Switzerland

description: Egypt’s Minister of Health and Population, Khaled Abdel Ghaffar, presided over the signing of a cooperation protocol between the Ministry and the Egyptian African for Development Projects (EADP) on Sunday, in a significant move to bolster health tourism and project management in Africa. The agreement facilitates a direct and intimate collaboration in various sectors across […]
title: Health Ministry, EADP establish cooperation protocol for African initiatives

description: Rania Al-Mashat, Egypt’s Minister of International Cooperation and Governor for the World Bank Group, participated in two key events during the spring meetings of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank. The first event marked the launch of a new joint financing platform established by ten multilateral development banks (MDBs). This platform aims […]
title: Egypt’s Al-Mashat participates in launch of global development financing platform, attends WB Development Committee meeting

description: Tamer Waheed, Vice Chairman and Managing Director, commented, AAIB delivered a strong set of results YE 2023. description: Since the liberalisation of the exchange rate, three exchange companies have collectively amassed foreign currencies surpassing EGP 15.5bn, with Al Ahli Exchange leading the way, having gathered EGP 8.616bn. title: 3 Egyptian exchange companies surpass EGP 15bn in foreign currency collections post-liberalisation
